com.paypal.paypalretailsdk

Class PaymentDevice

  • java.lang.Object
    • PayPalRetailObject
      • com.paypal.paypalretailsdk.PaymentDevice

  • public class PaymentDevice
extends PayPalRetailObject
    A payment device represents the abstract concept of something that can read payment information from a customer. This includes card swipe readers, EMV readers, barcode scanners, biometric devices we don't have yet, and DNA sequencers. Ok, not so much that last bit.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  PaymentDevice.BatteryInfoCallback
      The battery status has been updated
      static interface  PaymentDevice.BatteryStatusUpdateObserver
      The battery status has been updated
      static interface  PaymentDevice.CardPresentedObserver
      Depending on your region and the buyer payment type, this can mean a magnetic card was swiped, an EMV card was inserted, or an NFC card/device was tapped.
      static interface  PaymentDevice.CardRemovedObserver
      A card has been removed (generally from an EMV reader, where the card stays in the reader for some time)
      static interface  PaymentDevice.ConnectCallback 
      static interface  PaymentDevice.ConnectedObserver
      The reader is now connected and ready.
      static interface  PaymentDevice.ConnectionErrorObserver
      The connection attempt with the reader failed
      static interface  PaymentDevice.DeviceLogsCallback 
      static interface  PaymentDevice.DisconnectCallback 
      static interface  PaymentDevice.DisconnectedObserver
      The reader is now disconnected.
      static interface  PaymentDevice.SelectedObserver
      The reader is now selected and active to be used.
      static interface  PaymentDevice.UpdateRequiredObserver
      A software update is required for the reader.
